title: Ability to buy PRO subscriptions by arbitrary reduced prices
vulnerability_information:
Hey team,

I've found that a malicious user can buy PRO subscriptions by arbitrarily reduced prices.

##Steps to reproduce
0) Make sure you have an account without subscriptions at APM PRO bought. If you don't â€“ register a new one. It works for me inside the EU accounts at least.
1) Sign in this account with the owner
2) Navigate to Account settings -> Account -> Subscription
3) Click the `Upgrade` link near the `APM lite` product.
4) Choose the following options: `Cloud-based`, `Essentials`, `Monthly`, `1500` Compute Units
5) Click `Add to cart`
6) You should use the Burp Suite here. Navigate to Proxy -> Options, scroll down to `Match and Replace`, then click `Add`
{F696810}
7) Choose options: `Request body`, `0.025`, `0.00001` and click `OK`
{F696811}
8) Make sure the rule is enabled
9) Go back to the NR and click `Proceed to checkout`
{F696813}
10) If the account billing info wasn't yet filled, you should fill it correctly at the checkout page
{F696814}
11) If there is no card added to your account, you should add one. **Important**: please do not use a card with a lot of funds (to protect them in a potential case when the purchase would be charged for a whole price).
12) When the `TOTAL CHARGES` has appeared, look at the last Burp Suite request to the `https://self-serve.service.newrelic.com/accounts/2600636/zuora_api/subscription_preview`.
The **original request** looks like the following:
```http
POST /accounts/2600636/zuora_api/subscription_preview HTTP/1.1
Host: self-serve.service.newrelic.com
<redacted>

{"products":...{"product_id":"2c92a0fe6667909901667bc2acaf5842","commitment_period":"monthly","price":0.025,"pricing_quantity":1500,...
```
You can see that the origin request contains original APM Essentials price: 1500 computing units X $0.025 per unit.
Click the **auto-modified request** tab, you will see that the price is changed here according to `Match and replace` rules you've added at step 7:
```http
"product_id":"2c92a0fe6667909901667bc2acaf5842","commitment_period":"monthly","price":0.00001,"pricing_quantity":1500,
```
As you can see we've asked the Zuora to sell this 1500 units by reduced price of $0.00001 per unit.
Now look at the response:
```json
{"meta":{"timestamp":"2020-01-26T17:07:28.126131Z","count":1},"data":{"proration":0,"nextPaymentDate":null,"new_monthly_total":37.5,"early_termination_fee":null}}
```
This is where the magic begins :) As you can see, the Zuora has ignored our reduced price and tries to bill us for $37.5 (which is 0.025 * 1500). And this is what you see at `TOTAL CHARGES` at the checkout page. But don't pay an attention to this :)
13) Press `Submit payment`
14) Make sure your card was actually charged for only $0.02, which is the rounded value of our reduced price (0.00001 * 1500 = 0.015).
{F696838}
15) Navigate to `Subscriptions` and make sure you are now an "account which has special pricing terms and privileges" and you have a subscription to 1500 APM Essentials units practically for nothing ðŸ˜Ž
{F696835}

P.S.: while researching this, I've bought a full-price Synthetics PRO subscription for $103.50 so I would much appreciate if you can compensate it in a bonus ðŸ˜…
My invoice:
https://self-serve.service.newrelic.com/accounts/2600488/zuora_api/invoice/2c92a0de6fcbe889016fe0a8d5b3261f
 {F696798}

## Impact

Malicious users can buy PRO subscriptions for a dramatically reduced price.
vulnerability_information_html:
Hey team,

I've found that a malicious user can buy PRO subscriptions by arbitrarily reduced prices.

Steps to reproduce

0) Make sure you have an account without subscriptions at APM PRO bought. If you don't â€“ register a new one. It works for me inside the EU accounts at least.
1) Sign in this account with the owner
2) Navigate to Account settings -> Account -> Subscription
3) Click the Upgrade link near the APM lite product.
4) Choose the following options: Cloud-based, Essentials, Monthly, 1500 Compute Units
5) Click Add to cart
6) You should use the Burp Suite here. Navigate to Proxy -> Options, scroll down to Match and Replace, then click Add

7) Choose options: Request body, 0.025, 0.00001 and click OK

8) Make sure the rule is enabled
9) Go back to the NR and click Proceed to checkout

10) If the account billing info wasn't yet filled, you should fill it correctly at the checkout page

11) If there is no card added to your account, you should add one. Important: please do not use a card with a lot of funds (to protect them in a potential case when the purchase would be charged for a whole price).
12) When the TOTAL CHARGES has appeared, look at the last Burp Suite request to the https://self-serve.service.newrelic.com/accounts/2600636/zuora_api/subscription_preview.
The original request looks like the following:

POST /accounts/2600636/zuora_api/subscription_preview HTTP/1.1
Host: self-serve.service.newrelic.com
<redacted>

{"products":...{"product_id":"2c92a0fe6667909901667bc2acaf5842","commitment_period":"monthly","price":0.025,"pricing_quantity":1500,...

You can see that the origin request contains original APM Essentials price: 1500 computing units X $0.025 per unit.
Click the auto-modified request tab, you will see that the price is changed here according to Match and replace rules you've added at step 7:

"product_id":"2c92a0fe6667909901667bc2acaf5842","commitment_period":"monthly","price":0.00001,"pricing_quantity":1500,

As you can see we've asked the Zuora to sell this 1500 units by reduced price of $0.00001 per unit.
Now look at the response:

{"meta":{"timestamp":"2020-01-26T17:07:28.126131Z","count":1},"data":{"proration":0,"nextPaymentDate":null,"new_monthly_total":37.5,"early_termination_fee":null}}

This is where the magic begins :) As you can see, the Zuora has ignored our reduced price and tries to bill us for $37.5 (which is 0.025 * 1500). And this is what you see at TOTAL CHARGES at the checkout page. But don't pay an attention to this :)
13) Press Submit payment
14) Make sure your card was actually charged for only $0.02, which is the rounded value of our reduced price (0.00001 * 1500 = 0.015).

15) Navigate to Subscriptions and make sure you are now an "account which has special pricing terms and privileges" and you have a subscription to 1500 APM Essentials units practically for nothing ðŸ˜Ž

P.S.: while researching this, I've bought a full-price Synthetics PRO subscription for $103.50 so I would much appreciate if you can compensate it in a bonus ðŸ˜…
My invoice:
https://self-serve.service.newrelic.com/accounts/2600488/zuora_api/invoice/2c92a0de6fcbe889016fe0a8d5b3261f

Impact

Malicious users can buy PRO subscriptions for a dramatically reduced price.

activities.markdown_message:
Guys, can you please help me with making my new account 2600488 the Partnership owner or at least a simple Partnership one? I've bought a Synthetics subscription there but I still can only create one-layer subaccounts, not do something like here:

The Partnership console is still not working inside also.

activities.message:
Here is an invoice confirming we've bought the 1500 APM units for $0.02.
{F696841}
activities.markdown_message: Here is an invoice confirming we've bought the 1500 APM units for $0.02.

activities.message:
Hi @skavans,

Thanks for bringing this to our attention.

I'm currently discussing the potential scope of this issue with the team and once decided I will triage appropriately.

I appreciate your patience while we continue to investigate this.

Thanks,
Joe
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @skavans,

Thanks for bringing this to our attention.

I'm currently discussing the potential scope of this issue with the team and once decided I will triage appropriately.

I appreciate your patience while we continue to investigate this.

Thanks,
Joe

activities.message:
Hi @skavans,

I have now triaged this with the teams responsible to resolve.

We don't consider this to be a security vulnerability exactly and view it as more of a business logic error with a low likelihood of exploitation that would eventually be caught by our billing and auditing services.

As such I'm setting the severity here to "Low".

I understand that you have accidentally purchased a subscription in the process of testing this, in this case as an exception I will add the amount paid as a bonus to this report.

In future please be aware that any further charges incurred in testing vulnerabilities will not be reimbursed and you would need to follow standard cancellation policies.

Thanks for helping to make New Relic safer!

Hey @jmcevoy,

Thanks for the bonus provided! However, it is disappointing that you rate this submission so low. Itâ€™s my lowest bounty here despite the fact that:

  • the pretty similar issue #219356 was triaged as Medium;
  • you said that your audit system detects this, however my own exploitations werenâ€™t detected;
  • itâ€™s pretty easy to exploit;
  • it leads to the direct funds loss.

activities.message:
Hi @skavans,

The issue in #219356 was reported to us much earlier in our program (nearly 3 years ago) and our policies and procedures have shifted a bit since then.

As @jmcevoy mentioned, accounts are audited internally, but this is not a fully automated process. Anyone can get a free account or sign up for a Developer account and use New Relic to some extent. But when usage exceeds what is expected vs. the overall money spent, accounts are flagged to our Sales and/or Finance teams.

activities.message: I believe this has been resolved. Feel free to re-open or comment in the ticket if you see an incomplete fix.
